meta.content: At NYOS Charter School, we educate the whole student. We foster a collegial Pre-K - 12 program that challenges each learner with rigorous academics, innovative strategies and expectations for civic engagement.

img.alt: An Elementary student writing at her desk.

div.p: NYOS Charter School—Not Your Ordinary School—is a free, public charter school that was founded in 1998 by a group of parents who wanted more out of education for their children. It is through a commitment to our students, our staff and our academic excellence that we have been able to grow to serving more than 1,000 students in PreK through 12th grade.

img.alt: A teacher laughs with two Elementary students.

div.p: From our Elementary schedule, to supply lists, to extracurricular opportunities, go here to learn more about our Elementary grades.

img.alt: Two Secondary students reading a book together.

div.p: From our Secondary Bell Schedule, to club opportunities, to AP resources, go here to learn more about 6th through 12th grade.

img.alt: Three Elementary students running on the playground.

div.p: From parent forms, to our monthly cafeteria menu, to our our Parent/Student Handbook, go here to learn more about NYOS parent resources.

img.alt: One teacher helping two students with a science experiment.

div.p: As a free, public charter school, NYOS receives $3,800 less per student in government funding compared to traditional public schools. NYOS Charter School's academic results are substantially higher than those of surrounding schools, and as a charter school, we rely on the support of our school community to continue our commitment of academic success.

img.alt: High school graduates throwing graduation caps in the air

div.p: Read success stories from NYOS Alumni!
Learn more about our campus locations and tour opportunities!

img.alt: img alt- one male and one female middle school student smile while looking off into the distance

em.strong: At NYOS Charter School, we educate the whole student. We foster a collegial Pre-K – 12 program that challenges each learner with rigorous academics, innovative strategies and expectations for civic engagement.

img.alt: U.S. News & World Report 2019 National Silver Award and Level 4 Certification as a Marzano High Reliability School

div.div: NYOS is organizing a singalong for our Elementary students on Friday, April 24th! Go here to learn more!

img.alt: Texas Education Agency logo. TEA is blue and there is an orange graduation cap on the letter

h3.a: TEA English Learner Portal - Portal de aprendizaje Inglés de TEA

div.div: The Texas Education Agency (TEA) has created a new web portal with helpful resources for families related to English Language Learners in Texas. - La Agencia de Educación de Texas (TEA) ha creado un nuevo portal web con recursos útiles para las familias relacionadas con estudiantes del idioma inglés en Texas.

img.alt: Two music notes that are black, grey, and navy blue

div.div: NYOS is offering two new electives, Middle School Choir and AP Music Theory, for the 2020-2021 school year. Go here to learn more.

img.alt: Sprout school supplies logo in orange and green

div.div: Get a jump start by purchasing a school supply kit for the 2020-2021 school year by going here.

img.alt: Blue, black and white logo for AP College Board

div.div: Is your student taking an AP exam for the 2019-2020 school year? If so, please read the following new updates provided by AP College Board, found here.
During this time of at-home learning, our TAFE students has come together to create a series of brand new e-newsletters, called the TAFE Tribune. Go here to read the first issue of the TAFE Tribune!

Dear NYOS Community,
Texas Governor Greg Abbott extended the temporary closure of all schools, including NYOS, to in-person attendance until May 4, 2020. As we planned, NYOS will start its at home learning program on April 6th. We will continue at home learning until at least May 4th, per the Governor's order.
On Monday, we happily welcomed back NYOS teachers and staff. It was good to see everyone, even if just through Google Hangouts and Zoom! We spent Monday and Tuesday working together on at home learning plans for all students. That work will continue throughout this week. Don't be surprised if you or your students hear from teachers this week, testing technology use, sharing expectations, and saying hello.
Please check out NYOS resources online for Elementary and Secondary programs.
Thanks for your support and patience through this ever-changing information. We appreciate you and we miss you.
Take care,
Kathleen Zimmermann
Executive Director
